plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant with large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun's movement during the day. Sunflowers are widely cultivated for their seeds and oil and are iconic in late summer landscapes.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, native to North America
plants.funFact: Sunflower heads are made up of hundreds of tiny flowers called florets, which mature into seeds.

plants.name: Hydrangea macrophylla
plants.description: Deciduous shrub known for large, globe-shaped flower clusters that can change color based on soil pH, blooming profusely in summer.
plants.location: East Asia, commonly cultivated worldwide in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: The blue or pink color of Hydrangea flowers depends on soil acidity‚Äîacidic soils produce blue flowers, alkaline soils pink.

plants.funFact: The protea flower is named after the Greek god Proteus, who could change his form, reflecting the flower's diverse shapes.

plants.name: Epilobium angustifolium
plants.description: A perennial herb with tall spikes of bright pink-purple flowers, often one of the first plants to colonize burned forests in northern temperate and boreal regions.
plants.location: Northern Hemisphere, including North America and Europe
plants.funFact: Fireweed spreads rapidly after fires, helping to stabilize and enrich soil for other plants to grow.
